body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky, farmer and politician. Charlotte County, Virginia, native. Married to Hetta Jackson Hines in Warren County in May 1817. Married to Regina Collins Hines in Warren County in December 1827. Father of Martha Hines and Hetty Hines. Married to Sally Gatton Hines in Warren County in October 1832. Father of Sarah J. Hines and John Hines. Married to Tabitha A. Hines. Father of William H. Hines. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Representative in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1859. Elected to House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1859, resigning in 1860. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned thirty-three enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860.
